turns.text: So do you have any recycling programs there
turns.label: qy

turns.text: Um I dont really think we have anything in the works as of yet
turns.label: ng

turns.text: Uh were pretty small town and uh the closest thing we have are bins like out in front of Wal-Mart --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- that show you know plastics paper --
-- liter bottles et cetera et cetera
Weve progressed little bit farther than that
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Um actually they have uh - parts of town - it may have even spread all over the whole town and um they will have these green bins --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- and its just as standard as regular trash can that they come by and pick up and dump
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And uh just along with trash can you have this this green plastic bin and you put your bottles in it and paper and uh you know all those things that wh- aluminum You know anything that can be recycled you just put in that bin
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And uh I guess you can al- and lot of the restaurants --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- they just have uh places where you can throw away especially beer places where you can throw away green bottles
and then the brown bottles And uh oh I dont know I guess theyre you know clear bottles
So um you know lot of people do have those separated And of course they have the um dumpsters uh the the igloos
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Uh and they have those strateg- strategically placed around the city
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And uh theyre theyre actually going to extend it I think one of these days maybe to apartment complexes and uh -
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah things of that nature So I guess when you live in bigger city it it really becomes uh
turns.label: b

turns.text: its not anywhere near that Uh we you know - as far as our little pitch in to it we do recycle our aluminum cans
But thats as far as we go because I take them to girl at work and she goes and cashes them in because you know - I just --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- I can do that for her and --
-- and I dont want the hassle because we have to go to another town to do it
see we dont have anything here in Belton Its its pretty small little town
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah I remember my grandparents and I used to always get out there on the road and pick up beer cans
turns.label: b

turns.text: So you know thats about all the that were doing here Uh theyre uh getting little bit more on they need to lot more community awareness of just what is it mean to recycle and what can you recycle and what you cant
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Because you know not lot of people do really know what you know what its for
Yeah theyre doing real good job of uh separating it here And of course there you know you have specific place to put your paper
turns.label: b

turns.text: And uh they try to get you to go ahead and separate it but they actually have the door to door pickup Um and its uh I think it started out to be um just kind of test pilot project
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And it went over so well that they just extended it And its almost uh - I dont know if its done by private company or not It may be But uh they just go around to each uh door and pick it up
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Lets see Oh and every year of course the phone books --
turns.label: ^h

turns.text: -- um they tell everybody across the city to uh put all their phone books in uh the uh recycle bins
Because you know phone books are pretty - well for bigger city theyre pretty thick
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And sometimes you might have two or three
turns.label: sd

turns.text: So uh thats thats big savings right there in itself
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Yeah see ours just goes in the regular trash
turns.label: aa

turns.text: you know theres not whole lot And there are you know some places that will set up you know for old newspapers and stuff
But usually its it it hasnt caught on yet Im hoping it will soon
turns.label: sd

turns.text: uh-huh Well the thing about newspapers and paper - recycled paper is actually very expensive
turns.label: b

turns.text: So when you see something thats on recycled paper theyve actually gone to lot of expense to do that Its uh - theyre not coming out ahead at all Its uh its really cost
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Huh I wasnt totally aware of that
turns.label: sd

turns.text: I mean it it sounds good to the public but theres really big cost incurred when you do recycle something Now aluminum I dont know They may be coming out ahead But I know
